channel.title: Workspace setup on Recommender System Solution
channel.description: Recent content in Workspace setup on Recommender System Solution

item.title: AWS Cloud9
item.description: AWS Cloud9 is a cloud-based integrated development environment (IDE) that lets you write, run, and debug your code with just a browser. It includes a code editor, debugger, and terminal. Create new Cloud9 IDE environment If you donâ€™t already have an AWS account with Administrator access: [create one now by clicking here]https://aws.amazon.com/getting-started/ Go to AWS Cloud9 Console Use the region drop list to select Asia Pacific (Tokyo)ap-northeast-1 Click Create environment button to create an cloud9 environment Name it rs-workshop, click Next Take all default values and click Create environment This will take about 1-2 minutes to provision

item.title: Create an IAM role for your workspace
item.description: Starting from here, when you see command to be entered such as below, you will enter these commands into Cloud9 IDE. You can use the Copy to clipboard feature (right hand upper corner) to simply copy and paste into Cloud9. In order to paste, you can use Ctrl + V for Windows or Command + V for Mac. Follow this deep link to create an IAM role with Administrator access.

item.title: Attach the IAM role to your workspace
item.description: Click the grey circle button (in top right corner) and select Manage EC2 Instance. EC2 dashboard will be opened, select the “aws-cloud9-rs-workshop-xxx” instance, then choose Actions / Security / Modify IAM Role Choose gcr-rs-workshop-admin from the IAM Role drop down, and select Save

item.title: Update IAM settings for your workspace
item.description: Cloud9 normally manages IAM credentials dynamically. This isn’t currently compatible with the EKS IAM authentication, so we will disable it and rely on the IAM role instead. Starting from here, when you see command to be entered such as below, you will enter these commands into Cloud9 IDE. You can use the Copy to clipboard feature (right hand upper corner) to simply copy and paste into Cloud9. In order to paste, you can use Ctrl + V for Windows or Command + V for Mac.

item.title: Create an SSH key
item.description: Please run this command to generate SSH Key in Cloud9. This key will be used on the worker node instances to allow ssh access if necessary. ssh-keygen Press enter 3 times to take the default choices Upload the public key to your EC2 region: aws ec2 import-key-pair --key-name "gcrrsworkshop" --public-key-material file://~/.
